> I know the difference between the two.  I've watched all the G1 series
> episodes so I do know that.  The Seekers are far more sentient than the
> Sweeps and to me far more intelligent.

Okay. You confused me when Noctorro told Tuscon that Seekers had
attacked and Tuscon said,

> "Seekers?  But how? They're out scouting the parameters, I saw them myself.
> Something is very wrong here."

Since it was the sweeps who were actually out there I wasn't sure if
you knew the difference. But it's all clear now :)


> So one question does remain, is Dark Rodimus a living extension of Rodimus
> that somehow remained after he got rescued?  And is there a possibility that
> Tucson will have to face off with the real Rodimus to get him to realize that he has
> a serious demon to get rid of?  And could there be a demon to slay on Tucson's
> end too?  After all he isn't without his weaknesses too.  I guess what I'm asking is,
> could this be a sort of test for both Rodimus and Tucson Prime, who seem to
> suffer from lack of self confidence and anger management?  And can they actually
> help each other overcome these weaknesses and win a victory in the name of their
> factions?  Just curious about the storyline in general.

Well hmmm,

I don't want to reveal things that Hydras and Tuscon don't know yet.
But I will say that I don't have demons running around as everything
is sci-fi and technology based, but there is something is strange
about all of this. Yes there is a test coming for Tuscon as he
embraces this new form of his. And yes there is a test for Rodimus
himself as well. And the results of this can indeed have a profound
and permenant affect on his as well as his role amongst the Maximals.

And don't forget there was an important question that Leo had asked
Rodimus right before he left. Tuscon didn't hear the question, but
Rodimus said he would answer it when he got back.

There are many things going on - and I am using this thread to make a
few adjustments as well - some of which will be seen shortly :)

Buckle your seat belts and be prepared for a bumpy but hopefully a fun
ride! If you have questions, please feel free to ask. i won't be able
to answer much about what your characters can't know yet, but I can
help you to see what you should already be seeing . . . if that makes
sense?

- Preston
